III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
Section • (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or parents
Description and the foster parents in the development of service plans
to enable the parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the parents' and the
1

foster parent's role in assisting the agency in carrying out
the plan. An agency shall give a copy to and review the
parent-agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the parent or
parents and foster parent that the information in the parent-
agency treatment plan and any other information about the
child and the child's family is confidential.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster care workers have not provided a respondent parent with
timely updated service plans with updated parent agency
treatment plans.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Attorney was interviewed by phone on 7/23/2025. She stated
case service plans are not sent to Parent A. She stated Foster
Care Worker says Parent A told her that Attorney does not want
her to review or sign service plans until Attorney has a chance to
look at them, but Foster Care Worker is not even providing the
service plans to Parent A.
Parent A was interviewed by phone on 7/23/2025. She reported
when the initial service plan was completed, Attorney was on
vacation. She stated Foster Care Worker presented Parent A with
the document in person and Parent A asked if her attorney
needed to review it before she signed. Foster Care Worker told
her that it was not necessary, so Parent A signed the treatment
plan. Parent A stated Attorney was upset that she signed it and
told Parent A she wanted to be present and review the treatment
plans before Parent A signed them in the future. Parent A stated
she has not been provided with a service plan since that initial
report. She stated Foster Care Worker told her they have not been
giving her PATPs because she has asked her attorney to review
them.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via video conferencing on
8/11/2025. She reported she met with Parent A in person to go
over the ISP and treatment plan, which Parent A signed. Attorney
later told Foster Care Worker that Parent A said Foster Care
Worker forced her to sign the PATP. Attorney told Foster Care
Worker to never provide Parent A with a service plan unless
Attorney was present or was copied on the email. Foster Care
Worker stated she has since sent all reports to Parent A via email
with a copy to her supervisor and Attorney. Foster Care Worker
stated Parent A has not signed any PATPs since signing the
original PATP despite having been provided all of them.
2

Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via video conferencing
on 8/15/2025. She reported Foster Care Worker provides Parent
A with her treatment plans in person and via emails on which
Foster Care Supervisor is typically cc’d. She stated Parent A told
Foster Care Worker she needs Attorney to review all treatment
plans before she can discuss them with Foster Care Worker.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
The following parent agency treatment plans were reviewed for
signature:
• 4/12/2024, signed by Parent A 4/30/2024
• 7/11/2024 documented to have been emailed 8/19/2024
• 10/9/2024 no parent signature
• 1/7/2025, no parent signature
• 4/7/2025, no parent signature
• 7/3/2025, no parent signature
The following emails from Foster Care Worker were reviewed:
• 5/29/2024 from Parent A to Foster Care Worker stating:
o My attorney should be present for meetings.
o My attorney should also receive all documents and
route them to me should signature be required.
• 8/19/2024 to Parent A and Attorney with 7/11/2024 PATP
attached and the following narrative from Foster Care
Worker:
o Please review the attached the Parent Agency
Treatment Plan from the reporting period of 4/13/24
– 7/11/24. You’ll notice on page 10 that there are 3
series of boxes above the signature line that asks
questions about participation and agreement. If you
do not agree with the service plan, you are able to
utilize those boxes accordingly, but please sign and
return the PATP to me with your choices marked
• 3/4/2025 to Parent A and Attorney with 1/7/2025 PATP
attached with the following narrative from Foster Care
Worker:
o Please review, sign, and return this to me after
checking the boxes that you feel to be most
appropriate. If you have any questions, please feel
free to reach out and I will do my best to answer
them!
3

• 5/23/2025 to Parent A and Attorney with 4/7/2025 PATP
attached with the following narrative from Foster Care
Worker:
o Previously, I was sending the PATP’s over email as
requested. I was just informed that you would like
me to review it with you in person moving forward
• 7/18/2025 to Parent A and Attorney with 7/3/2025 PATP
attached with the following narrative from Foster Care
Worker:
o As previously requested, I have CC’d your attorney.
If you have any questions, please let me know, as I
am more than happy to review it with you either over
the phone or in person.
Analysis Despite documentation of the majority of Parent Agency
Treatment Plans having been provided to Parent A, there is no
documentation of Parent A being provided with the Parent Agency
Treatment Plan dated 10/9/2024; therefore, a violation has been
established.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
Section • (2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
Description child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Foster care is not completing service plans timely.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Attorney was interviewed by phone on 7/23/2025. She stated she
represents Parent A whose child, Youth A, is currently in foster
care. She stated case service plans are routinely completed late.
She stated the most recent updated service plan has not yet been
completed, despite it being past due. She stated Foster Care
Worker is required to complete the report every 90 days; however,
staff of the agency told her they have an additional 14 days for
corrections and supervisor approval, per MDHHS policy. Attorney
was insistent this is not allowed per policy. When it was confirmed
for her MDHHS policy does allow 14 days for report corrections
and approval, she stated the policy is illegal.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via video conferencing on
8/11/2025. She reported having been assigned to Youth A’s case
4

since he came into care in November 2024. She stated all the
service plans completed for Youth A’s case have been completed
timely.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via video conferencing
on 8/15/2025. She stated all of the service plans completed by
Foster Care Worker for Youth A’s case have been completed
timely. Attorney has told her several times she wants all service
plans at 90 days and does not believe the agency has 14 days to
review and approve the report following the submission at 90
days. She stated Attorney has told her she will file a licensing
complaint on every report that is not provided to her at 90 days.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
The following service plans were reviewed for timely completion:
• 3/14/2024-4/12/2024, report date 4/12/2024
• 4/13/2024- 7/11/2024, report date 7/11/2024
• 7/12/2024-10/9/2024, report date 10/9/2024
• 10/10/24-1/7/2025, report date1/7/2025
• 1/8/2025-4/7/2025, report date 4/7/2025
• 4/8/2025- 7/3/2025, report date 7/3/2025
Analysis The agency has been found in compliance as six service plans
were completed by Foster Care Worker for Youth A’s case. All of
which were completed timely.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
